abstract: Jeremy Lin, the acclaimed New York Knicks point guard, will undergo knee surgery this week and miss the rest of the regular N.B.A. season. Meanwhile, a former point guard for the Knicks, the two-time All-Star Stephon Marbury, led the Beijing Ducks to the national title in China. He scored 41 points in the final, which was watched by an estimated 80 million people.

headline.main: Knee Surgery for Lin, a Title for Marbury
